code: import Images from"../images/index";var cards=[{id:1,title:"Boatman's Ride",poem:["The Sun bounces off the water, but the soul is tranquil like the sky,","Until romance births the barter of two smiles and a twinkle in her eye,","The cold breeze flirts with two warm hearts as the boatman calls for a ride,","She grabs my hand, looks deep in my eyes and whispers,",'"Love has no place to hide."'],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_1},{id:2,title:"Morning Surprise",poem:["The cold envelopes me, as I awake from the dreams of the day before,","The room lit with a calming orange, reminds me of the sweater she wore,","I make my way to the balcony, yawning, rubbing the sleep out of my eyes,","The mountains! As my vision clears, I am spellbound and mesmerised,","I had forgotten of my travels. What a Morning Surprise!"],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_2},{id:3,title:"Patient Road",poem:["Bursting through the door of the transit bus, to find a seat and a soul,","A friend to keep you company as the journey gets quiet and cold,","Someone who knows that the beauty of the mountains, only he can afford,","Who pays his dues singing and wandering up the patient road."],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_3},{id:4,title:"No Signal.",poem:["Yes, we are city boys, we find our way using our phones.","Yes, our calm is noise, the peaceful streets have our minds blown.","So we wander till we are lost hoping not to be found,","Sometimes we like it with No Signal and nobody around."],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_4},{id:5,title:"Two kinds of Folk",poem:["There's two kinds of folk, bundled together in a bus that leaves for the hills,","Ones that shop to try and keep warm, others that challenge the Northern chills,","Ones that flock to the churches, the promenades, and sometimes the zoo,","Others that stumble into wrong rooms with fiery breath,","For they have forgotten, Who is Who?"],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_5},{id:6,title:"Winter wear",poem:["Mumbai, the tropic of India, has a bad joke in the name of a winter season,","I wore the same sweater on four trips, there's a good reason,","Come to Bombay, my pahadi friend, a sweater? No, you won't dare.","So if you see me in your summer, let me enjoy strutting in my winter wear."],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_6},{id:7,title:"Pahadis, The Mountain People",poem:["A happy smile, an unbroken spirit, and a fear for the unknown sin,","I suppose, life is so, when the cold gets as cold and the air gets as thin,","Our comforts don't tempt them, nor does envy bow their morals,","They live life with peace and presence, not a moment lost in petty quarrels."],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_7},{id:8,title:"Little Things",poem:["Many things feel new, unfamilar but beautiful when you answer the mountain calls,","I speak of the little things, not just the magnificient rocks and breathtaking waterfalls.","The mundane joys of fresh air, clear skies, and nonchalantly growing flowers,","Did we give up too much for the luxuries and the comforts of our city towers?"],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_8},{id:9,title:"Until Next Time",poem:["In the second year, we first stumbled across the mountains as a group of five friends,","Over the next few years, we made many beginnings and endured many bitter-sweet ends, ","We traveled with loose change, learnt to spit a rhyme and have dinner in just a dime,","Never once laboured a goodbye as we left the mountains, we preferred to say,","'Until Next Time'."],about:["This is about Photo Number: "],image:Images.img_9}];export default cards;

sourcesContent:
import Images from "../images/index";
const cards = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: "Boatman's Ride",
    poem: [
      "The Sun bounces off the water, but the soul is tranquil like the sky,",
      "Until romance births the barter of two smiles and a twinkle in her eye,",
      "The cold breeze flirts with two warm hearts as the boatman calls for a ride,",
      "She grabs my hand, looks deep in my eyes and whispers,",
      '"Love has no place to hide."',
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_1,
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    title: "Morning Surprise",
    poem: [
      "The cold envelopes me, as I awake from the dreams of the day before,",
      "The room lit with a calming orange, reminds me of the sweater she wore,",
      "I make my way to the balcony, yawning, rubbing the sleep out of my eyes,",
      "The mountains! As my vision clears, I am spellbound and mesmerised,",
      "I had forgotten of my travels. What a Morning Surprise!",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_2,
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    title: "Patient Road",
    poem: [
      "Bursting through the door of the transit bus, to find a seat and a soul,",
      "A friend to keep you company as the journey gets quiet and cold,",
      "Someone who knows that the beauty of the mountains, only he can afford,",
      "Who pays his dues singing and wandering up the patient road.",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_3,
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    title: "No Signal.",
    poem: [
      "Yes, we are city boys, we find our way using our phones.",
      "Yes, our calm is noise, the peaceful streets have our minds blown.",
      "So we wander till we are lost hoping not to be found,",
      "Sometimes we like it with No Signal and nobody around.",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_4,
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    title: "Two kinds of Folk",
    poem: [
      "There's two kinds of folk, bundled together in a bus that leaves for the hills,",
      "Ones that shop to try and keep warm, others that challenge the Northern chills,",
      "Ones that flock to the churches, the promenades, and sometimes the zoo,",
      "Others that stumble into wrong rooms with fiery breath,",
      "For they have forgotten, Who is Who?",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_5,
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    title: "Winter wear",
    poem: [
      "Mumbai, the tropic of India, has a bad joke in the name of a winter season,",
      "I wore the same sweater on four trips, there's a good reason,",
      "Come to Bombay, my pahadi friend, a sweater? No, you won't dare.",
      "So if you see me in your summer, let me enjoy strutting in my winter wear.",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_6,
  },
  {
    id: 7,
    title: "Pahadis, The Mountain People",
    poem: [
      "A happy smile, an unbroken spirit, and a fear for the unknown sin,",
      "I suppose, life is so, when the cold gets as cold and the air gets as thin,",
      "Our comforts don't tempt them, nor does envy bow their morals,",
      "They live life with peace and presence, not a moment lost in petty quarrels.",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_7,
  },
  {
    id: 8,
    title: "Little Things",
    poem: [
      "Many things feel new, unfamilar but beautiful when you answer the mountain calls,",
      "I speak of the little things, not just the magnificient rocks and breathtaking waterfalls.",
      "The mundane joys of fresh air, clear skies, and nonchalantly growing flowers,",
      "Did we give up too much for the luxuries and the comforts of our city towers?",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_8,
  },
  {
    id: 9,
    title: "Until Next Time",
    poem: [
      "In the second year, we first stumbled across the mountains as a group of five friends,",
      "Over the next few years, we made many beginnings and endured many bitter-sweet ends, ",
      "We traveled with loose change, learnt to spit a rhyme and have dinner in just a dime,",
      "Never once laboured a goodbye as we left the mountains, we preferred to say,",
      "'Until Next Time'.",
    ],
    about: ["This is about Photo Number: "],
    image: Images.img_9,
  },
];
export default cards;
